pullRequest.title: Issue 5852: Speed up build verification
pullRequest.bodyText:
Change log description
Reduce build times by running tests in parallel.
Fix many flakey test, and other test issues.
Purpose of the change
Attempts to parallelize where possible
Fixes #5852
What the code does
This mainly affect tests and build process. A few patches that were causing build failures are included.
This fixes #5864, #5008, #5657, #5515, #3691, #5565, #4966. And many others not previously reported.
How to verify it
We need to actually run several builds to make sure this works, and does not introduce race conditions, ooms etc.

nodes.bodyText: Minor: executionException -> ExecutionException. We don't necessarily need to address in this PR, but I'm wondering if we should be using @link for such references.

Haven't you used ledgers path + zkPort before? Should we use the same here? This is what I'm thinking about:
https://github.com/pravega/pravega/pull/4999/files#diff-7cb38ef4f69c054db7f40fc17995e399cfbc2c96cc35ec1e5d40a969e3bb3aedR62
Minor: extra spaces
It is odd that it is not recognizing this file as Java, is this just a UI bug?
Minor: extra spaces.

nodes.bodyText: why are we removing this.. this is a zookeeper node which needs to be cleaned up.
why not remove the reader from inside cell.stop which terminates the reader and only after that we remove it. here we could be removing it prematurely.
thank you :)
the reason why only FAILED event was present ref: #5441 (review)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -94,12 +94,13 @@ plugins.withId('java') {
         testLogging.showCauses = true
         testLogging.showExceptions = true
         testLogging.showStackTraces = true
-        testLogging.events = ["FAILED"]
-        maxParallelForks = System.properties['maxParallelForks'] ? System.properties['maxParallelForks'].toInteger() : 1
+        testLogging.events = ["STARTED", "PASSED", "SKIPPED", "FAILED"]

Allow artifact reuse between builds on the same branch.

Signed-off-by: Tom Kaitchuck <tom.kaitchuck@emc.com>

Reduce amount of data held in github actions cache.

This is done by pulling the source from the repo, and only holding onto
one copy of gradle's temporary files (instead of 3).

Signed-off-by: Tom Kaitchuck <tom.kaitchuck@emc.com>

Add timeout to HDFS recovery test.

Signed-off-by: Tom Kaitchuck <tom.kaitchuck@emc.com>

nodes.bodyText:
Can you verify that this change won't impact workflow re-runs?
The point of all these caches is to have a particular job finish right away if it previously completed successfully and we re-run the whole workflow.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -29,18 +29,24 @@ on:
 # Define a few constants that are shared across all the jobs.
 env:
   GLOBAL_CACHE_PATH: |
-    .gradle
     ~/.gradle
     ~/.m2
   GLOBAL_CACHE_KEY: gradle-m2-java-11
   GLOBAL_CACHE_RESTORE_KEYS: |
     gradle-m2-java-
     gradle-m2
-  # We cache the source code, resources and build output. This is generated on the build job and reused in dependent jobs.
-  BUILD_CACHE_PATH: ./*
+  # We cache the class files, resources and build output. This is generated on the build job and reused in dependent jobs.
+  BUILD_CACHE_PATH: |
+    .gradle

nodes.bodyText: What is the effect of this change? run_id would cache the output for re-runs of the same workflow.

nodes.bodyText: bindings:test is being invoked at line 161 too ...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -157,14 +157,39 @@ jobs:
         run: >
           ./gradlew
           segmentstore:server:test
-          segmentstore:storage:test
-          segmentstore:storage:impl:test
+          segmentstore:server:host:test
           bindings:test
           --parallel ${{env.GRADLE_OPTS}}
-      - name: Segment Store Host Tests      # Run this separately since it conflicts with segmentstore:storage:impl:test.
+      - name: Codecov
+        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v1.0.15
+
+  unit_storeage:
+    name: Storage Unit Tests
+    needs: build
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    steps:
+      - name: Gradle & Maven Cache
+        uses: actions/cache@v2.1.0
+        with:
+          path: ${{env.GLOBAL_CACHE_PATH}}
+          key: ${{env.GLOBAL_CACHE_KEY}}
+          restore-keys: ${{env.GLOBAL_CACHE_RESTORE_KEYS}}
+      - name: Build Output Cache
+        uses: actions/cache@v2.1.0
+        with:
+          path: ${{env.BUILD_CACHE_PATH}}
+          key: ${{github.run_id}}
+      - name: Test Output Cache
+        uses: actions/cache@v2.1.0
+        with:
+          path: ${{env.TEST_OUTPUT_CACHE_PATH}}
+          key: ${{github.run_id}}-${{github.job}}
+      - name: Segment Store Unit tests
         run: >
           ./gradlew
-          segmentstore:server:host:test
+          segmentstore:storage:test
+          segmentstore:storage:impl:test
+          bindings:test

nodes.bodyText: Did not understand the reason for this change here.
we could log the stream name here too...
👍  This should prevent port already in use on the GRPC server side.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -50,8 +52,9 @@ public GRPCServer(ControllerService controllerService, GRPCServerConfig serverCo
         this.config = serverConfig;
         GrpcAuthHelper authHelper = new GrpcAuthHelper(serverConfig.isAuthorizationEnabled(),
                 serverConfig.getTokenSigningKey(), serverConfig.getAccessTokenTTLInSeconds());
-        ServerBuilder<?> builder = ServerBuilder
+        ServerBuilder<?> builder = NettyServerBuilder
                 .forPort(serverConfig.getPort())
+                .withChildOption(ChannelOption.SO_REUSEADDR, true)

nodes.bodyText: Is there a reason this is run here (in All Other Unit Tests). This will perform these tests for every project.
We don't use travis anymore. I am pretty sure it's safe to delete this file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -22,6 +22,7 @@ jobs:
   include:
     # Travis CI build has been deprecated in favor of GitHub Actions.
     - stage: build
+      name: check

nodes.bodyText: Should this be set to the number of available processors? In Github Actions, we only have 2 cores per VM.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -90,11 +90,12 @@ plugins.withId('java') {
         testLogging.showExceptions = true
         testLogging.showStackTraces = true
         testLogging.events = ["FAILED"]
-        maxParallelForks = System.properties['maxParallelForks'] ? System.properties['maxParallelForks'].toInteger() : 1
+        maxParallelForks = System.properties['maxParallelForks'] ? System.properties['maxParallelForks'].toInteger() : 4

nodes.bodyText: I can't comment on the above binary file, but why did gradle-wrapper.jar change?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
 distributionBase=GRADLE_USER_HOME
 distributionPath=wrapper/dists
+distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-6.5.1-bin.zip

nodes.bodyText: Are these really necessary?
Was this the source of that cyclical reference we saw every now and then in logs?
Let's use config.getWriteTimeout().seconds() for this. At least we'll have a way to configure it in case we need to.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -78,20 +83,21 @@
      */
     static WriteHandle create(BookKeeper bookKeeper, BookKeeperConfig config, int logId) throws DurableDataLogException {
         try {
-
-            return Exceptions.handleInterruptedCall(() ->
-                    FutureUtils.result(bookKeeper.newCreateLedgerOp()
-                            .withEnsembleSize(config.getBkEnsembleSize())
-                            .withWriteQuorumSize(config.getBkWriteQuorumSize())
-                            .withAckQuorumSize(config.getBkAckQuorumSize())
-                            .withDigestType(config.getDigestType())
-                            .withPassword(config.getBKPassword())
-                            .withCustomMetadata(createLedgerCustomMetadata(logId))
-                            .execute(), BK_EXCEPTION_HANDLER) );
+            CompletableFuture<WriteHandle> future = bookKeeper.newCreateLedgerOp()
+                .withEnsembleSize(config.getBkEnsembleSize())
+                .withWriteQuorumSize(config.getBkWriteQuorumSize())
+                .withAckQuorumSize(config.getBkAckQuorumSize())
+                .withDigestType(config.getDigestType())
+                .withPassword(config.getBKPassword())
+                .withCustomMetadata(createLedgerCustomMetadata(logId))
+                .execute();
+            return Futures.getAndHandleExceptions(future, BK_EXCEPTION_HANDLER, 20, TimeUnit.SECONDS);

commit.message:
PR feedback

Signed-off-by: Tom Kaitchuck <tom.kaitchuck@emc.com>

nodes.bodyText:
According to this reference:
https://discuss.gradle.org/t/set-maxparallelforks-to-number-of-cores-on-the-current-machine/4505
we can use: Runtime.runtime.availableProcessors.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -90,11 +90,12 @@ plugins.withId('java') {
         testLogging.showExceptions = true
         testLogging.showStackTraces = true
         testLogging.events = ["FAILED"]
-        maxParallelForks = System.properties['maxParallelForks'] ? System.properties['maxParallelForks'].toInteger() : 1
+        maxParallelForks = System.properties['maxParallelForks'] ? System.properties['maxParallelForks'].toInteger() : 4

nodes.bodyText: Are we using rack awareness in the tests?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -67,6 +68,8 @@ protected ServiceBuilderConfig getBuilderConfig(ServiceBuilderConfig.Builder con
         String id = Integer.toString(instanceId);
         return configBuilder
                 .makeCopy()
+                .include(BookKeeperConfig.builder().with(BookKeeperConfig.BK_ENFORCE_MIN_NUM_RACKS_PER_WRITE, false)

nodes.bodyText: This is setting a global timeout of two minutes, that's a lot, no?
This is also setting to two minutes, is it necessary to make it that long?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -262,7 +263,7 @@ public void testSegmentRestoration() throws Exception {
      *
      * @throws Exception If an exception occurred.
      */
-    @Test
+    @Test(timeout = 120000)

nodes.bodyText: This change seems unnecessary, what's the reason for this change?
Minor: remove leading white spaces. Shouldn't our checkstyle be complaining about these things?
It sounds like checkstyle is missing this rule.
Are you following any guidelines for test timeouts or are you determining it based on test failure observations?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@
  */
 public class SingleThreadEndToEndTest {
 
-    @Test(timeout = 30000)
+    @Test(timeout = 60000)

nodes.bodyText: For completeness, why did you have to write this class and what's that RunNotifier?
Since we are moving static analysis to unit_other, this should be changed to just Compile.
